noun.description: A woman who is (personally or politically) free; especially a woman who is not a slave.
A woman who possesses the freedom of a city, borough, company, etc.

Usually as two words. A woman who holds liberal, unconventional, or feminist views concerning the conventions traditionally governing feminine behaviour; a woman who does not abide by, or considers herself free of, such conventions.

origin: Middle English; earliest use found in St. Margaret. From free + woman. Compare Old English frēowīf freewoman, Middle High German vrīwīp freewoman. Compare also Dutch vrijvrouw member of the lower nobility, Middle High German vrīvrouwe freewoman (German Freifrau, now only as a title of lower nobility).
